page.title: 17HAVERING'S HISTORY
page.content: Most of Havering was once part of the Royal Liberty of Havering_atte_Bower. Havering palace was once visited by royalty.This led to a charter being granted by King Edward IV in 1465 exactly 500 years before the London Borough of Havering was formed. The charter gave residents more freedom hence the use of the word Liberty. A map of the district was published in 1618 and another map of details in 1771 shows the area was then mainly rural. However,this century has seen the local population soar from just 22,625 in 1901 to virtually a quarter of a million people in 1965_the year of Havering's birth.The population has not risen from this figure substantially in the past 20 years.
